touristSites.name: Eiffel Tower
touristSites.description: An iconic iron lattice tower built for the 1889 World's Fair, symbolizing Paris and offering panoramic city views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Observation decks with views of Paris, romantic ambiance, light shows in the evening, UNESCO proximity (Seine Banks).
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Trocadéro or Bir-Hakeim stations), near Paris airports (CDG, ORY).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather and fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Colosseum
touristSites.description: An ancient Roman amphitheater built in 70-80 AD, hosting gladiator contests and public spectacles.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, historical significance, guided tours of underground chambers, proximity to Roman Forum.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Colosseo station), near Rome Fiumicino Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (October-November) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.name: Sagrada Familia
touristSites.description: Antoni Gaudí’s unfinished modernist basilica, known for its unique architecture and intricate facades.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, stunning interiors with stained glass, Gaudí’s masterpiece, rooftop views.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Sagrada Família station), near Barcelona-El Prat Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (March-May) or Fall (September-November) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Acropolis
touristSites.description: A 5th-century BC citadel with the Parthenon, a temple dedicated to Athena, overlooking Athens.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, ancient Greek architecture, panoramic views, nearby Acropolis Museum.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Acropoli station), near Athens International Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) to avoid heat.

touristSites.name: Alhambra
touristSites.description: A 13th-century Islamic palace and fortress, showcasing Moorish architecture and intricate tilework.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, Patio of the Lions, Generalife gardens, stunning views of Granada.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or taxi from Granada center, near Málaga Airport (1.5-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.name: Mont Saint-Michel
touristSites.description: A medieval island abbey off the Normandy coast, famous for its unique position and Gothic architecture.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, dramatic tides, medieval village, spiritual significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; shuttle or walk from parking, 2-hour train from Paris to Rennes, then bus.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (May-June) or Fall (September-October) for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Neuschwanstein Castle
touristSites.description: A 19th-century fairy-tale castle built for King Ludwig II, nestled in the Bavarian Alps.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Inspiration for Disney’s Cinderella Castle, scenic mountain views, opulent interiors.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; train to Füssen, then bus or taxi, near Munich Airport (2-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) or Winter (December-February) for snowy landscapes.

touristSites.name: Rila Monastery
touristSites.description: A 10th-century Orthodox monastery in the Rila Mountains, known for its frescoes and architecture.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, serene mountain setting, vibrant frescoes, historical significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or car from Sofia (2-hour drive), limited public transport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) for accessible roads and hiking.

touristSites.name: Hallstatt
touristSites.description: A picturesque village on Lake Hallstatt, known for its stunning alpine scenery and historic salt mines.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, postcard-perfect views, salt mine tours, lake activities.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; train to Hallstatt station, then ferry, near Salzburg Airport (1.5-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) or Winter (December-February) for scenic beauty.

touristSites.name: Cliffs of Moher
touristSites.description: Dramatic coastal cliffs along the Atlantic, offering breathtaking views and hiking trails.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stunning ocean vistas, O’Brien’s Tower, wildlife (puffins), part of the Wild Atlantic Way.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus from Galway or Dublin, near Shannon Airport (1-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Eiffel Tower
touristSites.description: An iconic iron lattice tower built for the 1889 World's Fair, symbolizing Paris and offering panoramic city views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Observation decks with views of Paris, romantic ambiance, light shows in the evening, UNESCO proximity (Seine Banks).
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Trocadéro or Bir-Hakeim stations), near Paris airports (CDG, ORY).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather and fewer crowds.

touristSites.description: An ancient Roman amphitheater built in 70-80 AD, hosting gladiator contests and public spectacles.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, historical significance, guided tours of underground chambers, proximity to Roman Forum.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Colosseo station), near Rome Fiumicino Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (October-November) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, stunning interiors with stained glass, Gaudí’s masterpiece, rooftop views.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Sagrada Família station), near Barcelona-El Prat Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (March-May) or Fall (September-November) for mild weather.

touristSites.description: A 5th-century BC citadel with the Parthenon, a temple dedicated to Athena, overlooking Athens.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, ancient Greek architecture, panoramic views, nearby Acropolis Museum.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Acropoli station), near Athens International Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) to avoid heat.

touristSites.name: Alhambra

touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, Patio of the Lions, Generalife gardens, stunning views of Granada.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or taxi from Granada center, near Málaga Airport (1.5-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, dramatic tides, medieval village, spiritual significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; shuttle or walk from parking, 2-hour train from Paris to Rennes, then bus.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (May-June) or Fall (September-October) for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Neuschwanstein Castle
touristSites.description: A 19th-century fairy-tale castle built for King Ludwig II, nestled in the Bavarian Alps.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Inspiration for Disney’s Cinderella Castle, scenic mountain views, opulent interiors.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; train to Füssen, then bus or taxi, near Munich Airport (2-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) or Winter (December-February) for snowy landscapes.

touristSites.name: Rila Monastery
touristSites.description: A 10th-century Orthodox monastery in the Rila Mountains, known for its frescoes and architecture.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, serene mountain setting, vibrant frescoes, historical significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or car from Sofia (2-hour drive), limited public transport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) for accessible roads and hiking.

touristSites.name: Hallstatt
touristSites.description: A picturesque village on Lake Hallstatt, known for its stunning alpine scenery and historic salt mines.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, postcard-perfect views, salt mine tours, lake activities.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; train to Hallstatt station, then ferry, near Salzburg Airport (1.5-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) or Winter (December-February) for scenic beauty.

touristSites.name: Cliffs of Moher
touristSites.description: Dramatic coastal cliffs along the Atlantic, offering breathtaking views and hiking trails.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stunning ocean vistas, O’Brien’s Tower, wildlife (puffins), part of the Wild Atlantic Way.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus from Galway or Dublin, near Shannon Airport (1-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: St. Peter’s Basilica
touristSites.description: A Renaissance basilica in Vatican City, the heart of Catholicism, designed by architects like Michelangelo.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Michelangelo’s Pietà, dome climb with city views, papal significance, proximity to Sistine Chapel.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Ottaviano) from Rome, near Rome Fiumicino Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Prado Museum
touristSites.description: Spain’s premier art museum, showcasing works by Goya, Velázquez, and El Greco.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Las Meninas, extensive European art collection, beautifully restored galleries, near Retiro Park.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Atocha or Banco de España), near Madrid-Barajas Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Winter (November-March) for fewer crowds, except holiday peaks.

touristSites.name: Edinburgh Castle
touristSites.description: A historic fortress dominating Edinburgh’s skyline, home to the Scottish Crown Jewels.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Royal history, Stone of Destiny, panoramic city views, annual Edinburgh Festival nearby.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Edinburgh city center, near Edinburgh Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Lisbon Oceanarium
touristSites.description: One of Europe’s largest aquariums, featuring a vast central tank and diverse marine life.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Interactive exhibits, ocean conservation focus, modern Parque das Nações setting, family-friendly.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Oriente), near Lisbon Humberto Delgado Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but Spring (March-May) for pleasant city exploration.

touristSites.name: Buda Castle
touristSites.description: A Baroque castle complex overlooking the Danube, housing the Hungarian National Gallery.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Panoramic views, historical museums, nearby Fisherman’s Bastion, vibrant Buda district.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; funicular or bus from Budapest city center, near Budapest Liszt Ferenc Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Plitvice Lakes National Park
touristSites.description: A series of 16 terraced lakes connected by waterfalls in a lush forest setting.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, turquoise lakes, hiking trails, stunning biodiversity.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus from Zagreb or Zadar, near Zagreb Airport (2-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (May-June) or Fall (September-October) for vibrant colors and fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Rundetaarn
touristSites.description: A 17th-century round tower with a unique spiral ramp leading to an observation deck.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Panoramic views of Copenhagen, astronomical history, quirky architecture, central location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Copenhagen city center, near Copenhagen Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) for long days and clear skies.

touristSites.name: Meteora Monasteries
touristSites.description: A complex of monasteries built on rock pillars in the 14th-16th centuries, a marvel of engineering.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, spiritual significance, dramatic landscapes, historical frescoes.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; train or bus from Athens or Thessaloniki, near Ioannina Airport (2-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Bruges Historic Center
touristSites.description: A medieval city with canals, cobblestone streets, and well-preserved Gothic architecture.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, canal boat tours, Belfry of Bruges, chocolate and beer culture.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; train from Brussels (1-hour), near Brussels Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Winter (December) for Christmas markets.

touristSites.name: Pena Palace
touristSites.description: A colorful 19th-century Romanticist palace atop a hill in Sintra, blending Moorish and Manueline styles.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, vibrant architecture, lush gardens, proximity to other Sintra palaces.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; train from Lisbon to Sintra (40 minutes), then bus or taxi, near Lisbon Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (March-May) or Fall (September-October) for pleasant weather.
